Reviews.Title: “from greece with love”
Reviews.Author: eirinimade in greece :)
Reviews.Content: firstly in the rooms there was so dust that i can t explain in english mostly under the beds...the stuff did not laugh at all and they were in bad mood all the time...the rooms are just good and some of them they have inside doors to other room so there was a lot of noise...the place is good the hotel is near bus and metro station...

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with good transport links”
Reviews.Author: Sally S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, with contemporary decor, and the room was spacious. We got a good deal for a triple room and the location was well served by public transport. However, some staff were not that friendly and noisy guests in the room next door kept us awake at night. Requested an additional pillow - but didn't get one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: pearlydrops
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and I could not fault staff or rooms. Hotel is in an excellent location with cafes and a supermarket nearby. The tube station is a five minute walk at the end of the street. Tube takes 20 minutes to get into central Barcelona. Our main reason for staying in Barca was to visit the Nou Camp for a football game. The next time we visit I will most definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: g0ingplaces888
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and spacious, the staff were friendly and i got a good nights sleep every night! I have a daughter who's 11, i would definetley reccomend this hotel for families

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: missbusy
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is not a hotel in the center of the city with tourist and vendors everywhere. It is outside the center but a very good alternative if you do not want to stay in the city. The last time I was in Barcelona I was right on the Placa and I did not want to do that again so we picked Guillermo Tell. We arrived at 3am and were greeted by the friendly night staff. He was pretty much the only friendly one but we did not require much so that didn’t matter to us. The room was big and the bed was comfortable. The location was great right next to subway station. Buy a pack of metro tickets it’s the best way to get around and you will be on the metro a lot. This hotel was also near lots of great restaurants. We ate at the Chinese restaurant a few blocks away and it was delicious. Overall the next time I travel to Barcelona I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: lou984039
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days in Barcelona. Hotel is around the corner from subway station, Placa Molina, used public transportation from airport (had ordered the Barcelona Card prior to our departure). Room was very clean as is the hotel, they offer breakfast if you wish to eat at the hotel but nearby there are restaurants bars and even a convenient store to buy fresh produce snacks and wine! Access to a computer with internet in the lobby was a nice bonus. Staff at front desk not too friendly but available to answer inquiries. Would stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “surpisingly good”
Reviews.Author: oaviram
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 days on September. We got a room with a strange smell which was switched to another immediately. Room was medium size, and very clean. Breakfast is pretty cheap (apprx. 4 euros) Stuff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chasrocks
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. We spent one night before our cruise and one night after. We paid for a triple but the first day we stayed, they moved a cot in late in the day, not at checkin even though we were exhausted and wanted to take naps. We felt cheated since we paid for a triple but we did not have a triple until early evening. We got checked in at 2. The second day we stayed we were able to check in at noon and got a room with a real third bed which was more comfortable. The rooms are very small. Air conditioning could be a little cooler. The hotel does have free wi-fi and it works great. The shower has great pressure. Location is half a block from a metro stop and there is another one for a different line just a few blocks away. Employees are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Curt Staff Would Keep Us From Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: PacNWGuy
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was fine, price was reasonable, and location good, but the front desk staff went out of their way to make us feel unwanted. My wife injured her back and getting a bag of ice was like getting Republicans to raise taxes! When we asked about options to get to the airport, the staff wasn't particularly forthcoming about all of our choices. We had to dig these out on our own. Both my wife and grown daughter who are pretty mellow folks mentioned how rude the staff were.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for 3 star hotel, experiencing 5 star room and service”
Reviews.Author: yveshsieh
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights with a 3 years old. We arrived Barcelona airport around 10 PM, jumped onto taxi (cost 36 euro) and takes 30 min to Guillermo Tell. Reception (24 h) was extremely professional and friendly. Room was good size (3 beds), free internet access, elegant and very clean. It has pretty much everything you need, except hot water boiler and tea bags, but you can ask reception for tea and coffee for free. This hotel is run by extremely professional staff. Great location, friendly neighbourhood. Good coffee shops, supermarket, interesting local shops, metro, bus station within 2 min walking distance. We will definetly come back and gonna stay at least a week just to enjoy the good hotel service and great shopping around neighbourhood. Tip, for site seeing, don´t bother metro or bus. Taxi is cheap here, just jump on taxi, cost less than 7 euro to most of heritage site.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: mspeggy-11
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult son and I were looking for a pre-cruise hotel near Las Ramblas, because that was the only area I was familiar with in Barcelona. I waited too long to book a hotel right in that area and read some of your reviews about Guillermo Tell. The hotel is in a very convenient location. Close to metro where you can travel anywhere. The triple room was clean, quiet, comfortable and cool. There is a coffe shop a few doors down the street. The hotel rate was very competitive. We tried to book it for our return trip, but again waited too late. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: kevertje
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The location is 30 minutes walk from Pl. de Catalunya and easy to get by METRO. Staff didn't say much. We didn't go for the break fast because they are plenty of options nearby (Dia supermercado in the street) Free wireless internet is nice to check email on your phone. Great hotel, would consider to stay here again. We had a great long weekend here.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Bed in EUROPE”
Reviews.Author: Smiley_Traveller_10
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel on Tripadvisor while looking for a place close to a friend's house in Gracia. While on a map it may not look to be super central it is a nice neighbourhood and well connected. There is a metro stop across the street but we just walked everywhere as the weather was great. Bed was HUGE especially for Europe, room very clean and bathroom very nice. My bf had called in advance to have flowers in the room when we got there and the staff obliged (and for the agreed price- what a novelty!) There is an AMAZING bakery down the street called BOCI so we never tried the in house breakfast but do recommend the bakery/chocolate shop. When I stayed in Borne everyone said "watch your purse"- I never heard that once in this neighbourhood. Staff was friendly. Will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bruce093
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel: clean, comfortable beds, friendly and helpful staff, excellent location for someone who would like to see best parts of Barcelona . We were able to explore the city mostly by foot , and enjoyed the beautiful architecture of Barcelona. The Gaudi house called Casa Vicenta was 5 minutes walk from the hotel, Parc Guell- 30 min walk . However for someone who doesn't want to walk public transportation is very conveniently located close by, subway is very good and so are buses: clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Nice area”
Reviews.Author: Chris3081
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed in this motel in Summer 09..found it too be a very pleasant surprise. The Kayak map had placed it in the wrong area so I was beyond walking distance of the Plaza, but I could take a subway and hook on to the Metro (caution: this particular line quiet running at 9 pm whereas the newer connections run 7/24. I Also was wrong about the hotel having a pool. I was in the financial district which was considereably northwest. The best part of this area was that it was extremely safe, I felt confortable going to the ATM by myself there, and the local bakeries where to die for. Also the staff at the desk spoke English, and when I checked in I had trouble getting my phone to work but the desk was extremely helpful. I stayed here for about $80 online but less than a week before it was $500!

Reviews.Title: “excellent neighbourhood and steps from subway”
Reviews.Author: rrporto
Reviews.Content: It is 5 to 10 minutes away, by subway, from las ramblas. The hotel is located 50 meters from the subway station (Line L7 - Pl. Molina). Subway was never packed and very comfortable. There are places nearby where you can have breakfast for 7 or 8 euros. (I had breakfast at hotel 1 day and went out the other 2 days. The breakfast is ok, nothing special for the 13 euros they change you … so I recommend not to book this hotel with breakfast included). Staff is ok. Whenever I need an information about where to go or what to do they answered me promptly. there is a computer at the lobby where you can access internet for free. they have wifi also but I did not bring my computer so I can not opine about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough to stay there”
Reviews.Author: komalo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during my trip to Barcelona. The hotel is located very close to Plaza Molina metro station (just 3 stops from Plaza Catalunya). It is on the side quiet street, but you can find small restaurants and cafe pretty close. The hotel seems to be very quiet - but I agree that the walls and doors are not "noise-proof" :-). The room was spacious enough, clean, with nice bathroom. Only the view from the window was not nice ;-). The reception is is helpful. They explained us how we can get to the city center and where we can eat out. I didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, but mostly due to opinions of other travellers and also because of the price (13,50 EUR per person). But you can eat a small breakfast for 5 EUR in cafes around. I paid around 72 EUR/day/room, booked by booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal”
Reviews.Author: NicolaJA
Reviews.Content: Resonably priced, friendly helpful staff, good location for attractions. Churros & chocolate at Xurreria right next to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: KHAYES09
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the BA website and wasn't disspointed, we paid for a suite which was quite spacious, big bathroom, sofar area and double bed. The nearest station into the centre is the Pi Molina which takes you right through to Catalunya which is pretty much central to everything. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was noise. Other reviews had mentioned thin walls but we didn't hear much at all despite the hotel being busy. There is a safe in your room, it is about €4 a day to use although we didn't bother, after reading other reviews we didn't have breakfast in the hotel but found cafes/bars in the Catalunya which were reasonably priced. Would recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “So-so stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_1730
Reviews.Content: Had a pretty average stay at this hotel. I'm not sure that I would recommend it to others. Hotel staff were generally unfriendly and seemed bothered to be interrupted with questions. The walls of the hotel were paper thin, while standing in the hallway I could hear my friend zip and unzip her luggage behind a closed door. We could also hear all kinds of noise in the mornings as people left to start their days. The room amentias are very average. Our hair dryer was broken and they charge extra (5 euros/day) for use of the safe. On the upside, the price was good and it is fairly easy to navigate from the metro stop by the hotel (literally right around the corner) to the rest of barcelona. The area around the hotel felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-located, and affordable stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Leigh-Anne28
Reviews.Content: For the price, I am not sure you can find a better deal than this in Barcelona. Mostly, I have only positive feedback on Hotel Guillermo Tell as the rooms were extremely clean, staff was very helpful with directions & information, the metro stop is literally around the corner, the neighborhood was clean & safe feeling with cafes, atm's etc. nearby. My friend and I asked for a room not on the first floor to help with noise reduction and can honestly say we did not hear any of the other occupants during our stay. A few things to be aware of: 1) Even though the hotel's rooms are equipped with a safe that amenity is not included in the price of the room, I found this out once there and they charge about 5Euros a day to use the safe in your room 2) while the staff was helpful they were not very friendly which is ok but good to know 3) the metro stop that is close to the hotel is the FGC line not the main metro line which requires train switches almost every time. 4) the metro train switch is not bad but make sure you buy a T-10 card or something similar as you then do not have to buy a different ticket every time you switch

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: BibsLondon
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel considering it is only a 3 star hotel. Very posh looking, staff were ok. The only thing i did not like was the fact that the you could not open the bedroom windows very far, basically you could not see what is outside. No point paying for breakfast as there was not much choice. Other than that the location is very good and we enjoyed our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprized by facility and staff”
Reviews.Author: GaryKenosha
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay and would highly reccomend this hotel as a great bargain in this city with many hotels. The staff went out of their way to assist us in directions and reservations. Staff spoke excellent english. Since close to Metro great for getting around they city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lizzie867
Reviews.Content: Cheap hotel (around 50 euros a night) slightly out of the centre of Barcelona. Good value for money the hotel only offers breakfast in the way of food which we didn't bother with as it was 13 euros and the cafe over the road was good and cheap. Right next to an underground station, although this is the Ferrocarrils line (FGC) and not metro, but it is easy to change to a metro line at Catalunya. Only difficulty is getting to and from the airport via underground and it is 3 trains, or two and a walk in between which is what we did. Alternatively on the way there we took a train to Barcelona Sants and a taxi to the hotel from there was only 11 euros. The hotel seems to be in a bit of a business district and the hotel recommended we didn't eat in any local restaurants but head into Barcelona which we did (best restaurants were found at the bottom of Passeig de Gracia- we liked tapa tapa and divinus, they weren't overpriced as many on the Rambla and by the beach are). Hotel staff on the whole were friendly and spoke some English- enough to get by with our bit of Spanish (although Catalan is quite different). We had very friendly maid service everyday and they will come in until 1pm if you like a lie in. Hotel was very clean and well presented with free internet access in the lobby. Rooms quite large, nice on suite and good air conditioning. Also has sun blocking shutters- be warned they work so well you may sleep longer than expected! Tele and mini-bar in room- they didn't seem to mind us putting our own things in the mini fridge. Overall very pleased for the price and it's not on a dodgy side street off the Rambla which is always a bonus (we went off track in the middle of the day and found ourselves in uncomfortable prostitute land). We would go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location, decent room”
Reviews.Author: danielbaby
Reviews.Content: Room was decent. Free wireless access. Free computer in the lobby. Right next door to metro, super convenient. A few grocery stores close by. My only complaint was that we had a room on the first floor facing the street, also close to the front desk. Very noisy in the morning. Make sure to ask for a room with better side or higher floor. Otherwise the stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “big room and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sophiehew
Reviews.Content: Pros: The rooms are big compare to all the hotels I've been staying in Spain. Full bath with shower, walkable area with table and closet space. Rooms are very clean and beds are comfortable. The location is good, just around the corner(1 block) from Placa Molina station. The only disadvantage of this station is it is not a Metro line but a FCG station. So, the transfer to Aeroport/airport Renfe train can be a little tricky. The easier way is to walk to Fontana Metro Station(about 10 min walk) and transfer at Passeig de Gracia, then to Aeroport(train leaves every 30 min). Take about ~1 hour. The T-10(10 trips for 7.20 euro) pass works on Metro, FCG and Renfe and should only cost 1 trip. The lady on the front desk is very nice and knowledgeable. Skip the guys receptionists. They are what I call "clueless" and not helpful. Overall a good place to stay. Cons: The air conditional in my room is very sensitive to temperature. It will blow for 5 min and stop and blow again. Can be annoying and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a business partner who lives in Barcelona. The staff was very friendly and gave us the opportunity to fresh up when we turned up too early for check-in (08.00 am). The rooms are spacious and the bed was large for Spanish standards. Everything was kept very clean. The bathroom had all facilities and was comfortable. The hotel is located in a less touristic area of Barcelona and has a more authentic feel compared to e.g. the Ramblas area. Right next door to the hotel is a excellent backery with fresh sandwichs and great coffee. There are many restaurants within 5-10 min. walking distance. The Fontana sub-way station takes you in a couple of minutes to the Plaça de Catalunya, the start of many touristic ventures.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leelee18
Reviews.Content: the hotel is well situated, just 30 seconds walk around the corner of the metro station. there are bakery/cafe and a small supermarket nearby. we arrived late that night, but still managed to get a budget and light meal in the cafe near the hotel. room is clean and tidy. i was a bit disappointed about the bed in my room. i booked a triple room, and the third bed looked really 'extra', not having proper bed sheet on it and it's not comfortable, too soft, however, my bed was comfortable as it's a 'permanent' one. the hairdryer in the bathroom, it's the one with the tube like thing sitting on the wall. you have to hold the tube in a certain angle to get it swtiched on, however, it's loose, so i had to hold the tube for my friend, or else it stops every 5 seconds. but overall, it's a nice hotel ...

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Guillermo Tell
HotelInfo.Address: C Guillem Tell, 49, 08006 Barcelona, Spain
